message.content: create a backlog column in my kanban board

content.thinking: The user wants to add a backlog column to their kanban board. Let me first read the current page.tsx file to understand the existing kanban board structure.

I can see the kanban board structure. To add a backlog column, I need to:

1. Update the `Todo` interface to include "backlog" as a valid status
2. Add the backlog column to the `columns` array (should be first, before "todo")
3. Update the `addTodo` function to add new tasks to "backlog" instead of "todo" (or keep it as "todo" - I'll keep it adding to "todo" since that's more natural)

Let me make these changes.

content.text: I'll add a backlog column to your kanban board. I need to update the status type and add the new column.

content.content: The file /Users/evisdrenova/code/test-app/app/page.tsx has been updated successfully.

content.thinking: Now I need to add the backlog column to the columns array.

content.content: The file /Users/evisdrenova/code/test-app/app/page.tsx has been updated successfully.

lines: { id: "todo" as const, title: "To Do", color: "bg-zinc-500" },
{ id: "in-progress" as const, title: "In Progress", color: "bg-blue-500" },

content.thinking:
Done. I've added a backlog column with a purple color indicator. The column will appear first (leftmost) in the kanban board, which is the typical position for a backlog column. New tasks will still be added to the "To Do" column by default.

I could optionally add a sample task in the backlog, but I'll leave it as is since the user can add tasks themselves.

content.text: Done. I added a "Backlog" column with a purple indicator as the first column in your kanban board. New tasks will still be added to "To Do" by default, but you can drag them to Backlog or any other column.
